construct: Perceived Likelihood of Heat Wave Exposure

subconstructs.question: How likely is it that you, your family, or your community will be seriously impacted by at least one severe heat wave this summer...?
subconstructs.responseOptions: 0-100 (Not at all likely to Extremely likely)

subconstructs.name: Heatwave Worry
subconstructs.question: How worried are you about the effects of severe heat waves on...
questionItems: The well-being of others in your family
The well-being of others in your community
subconstructs.responseOptions: Not worried at all, A little worried, Moderately worried, Very worried, Extremely worried

subconstructs.name: Heatwave Harm
subconstructs.question: If a severe heat wave were to occur, how much do you think it would harm...
questionItems: The well-being of others in your family
The well-being of others in your community
subconstructs.responseOptions: Would cause no harm at all, A little harm, Moderate harm, A great deal of harm, Would cause extreme harm

subconstructs.name: Behavioral Intentions
subconstructs.question: If a severe heat wave occurs, how likely is it that you would…
questionItems: Take extra precautions to protect yourself
Check on vulnerable people you know (elderly neighbors, etc.)
subconstructs.responseOptions: Extremely unlikely, Moderately unlikely, Somewhat unlikely, Neither likely nor unlikely, Somewhat likely, Moderately likely, Extremely likely

construct: Perceived Threat of Heat Waves on Health

subconstructs.name: Heatwave Health Worry
subconstructs.question: If you were experiencing a severe heat wave... how worried would you be about the following health issues harming you, your family, or people in your community?
subconstructs.responseOptions: Not worried at all, A little worried, Moderately worried, Very worried, Extremely worried

subconstructs.name: Worry Medical Access
subconstructs.question: How worried are you about the impact of severe heat waves on your ability to be treated in a hospital?
subconstructs.responseOptions: Not worried at all, A little worried, Moderately worried, Very worried, Extremely worried

subconstructs.name: Healthcare System Impacts
subconstructs.question: How concerned are you that severe heat waves in your local area could result in the following impacts:
questionItems: Shortages of medical staff or resources
Increased (delayed) response times for emergency services
subconstructs.responseOptions: Not at all, A little amount, A moderate amount, Quite a bit, A great deal

construct: Knowledge of the Impact of Heat Waves

subconstructs.name: Knowledge
subconstructs.question: Please indicate how certain you are about whether the following statements are true or false. Extreme heat exposure can…
questionItems: Trigger premature labor in pregnant women
Trigger heart attacks among the vulnerable
subconstructs.responseOptions: -100 to 100 (100% certain it is FALSE to 100% certain it is TRUE)

subconstructs.name: Health Risks
subconstructs.question: What are the primary health risks that can result from exposure to extreme heat?
subconstructs.responseOptions: Min 2, Max 6 responses

subconstructs.name: Lower Body Temperature
subconstructs.question: What is the fastest way to lower someone's internal body temperature after extreme heat exposure?
subconstructs.responseOptions: Drinking ice-cold water, Wrapping an ice-cold towel around their head, Immersing them in a tub of ice water, Giving them electrolytes

subconstructs.name: Self-Efficacy
subconstructs.question: If you were to experience a severe heat wave... how confident are you that you would know what to do to keep yourself and others safe?
subconstructs.responseOptions: Not at all confident, A little confident, Moderately confident, Very confident, Extremely confident

subconstructs.name: Policies
subconstructs.question: Do you support or oppose the following policies?
questionItems: Federal, State, and Local Governments should invest resources to ensure that hospitals can run safely and effectively in severe heat waves
State and local governments should provide air-conditioned public spaces for people to use during severe heat waves to prevent heat-related health issues
subconstructs.responseOptions: -100 to 100 (Strongly oppose to Strongly support)

subconstructs.name: Tax Increase
subconstructs.question: How much more in overall income tax would you be willing to pay in order to ensure that your community and your hospitals are safer during severe heat waves?

subconstructs.name: Public
subconstructs.question: Do you agree or disagree that health professionals have a responsibility to bring the health effects of severe heat waves to the attention of: the public?
subconstructs.responseOptions: Strongly disagree, Moderately disagree, Slightly disagree, Neither agree nor disagree, Slightly agree, Moderately agree, Strongly agree

subconstructs.name: Policy Makers
subconstructs.question: Do you agree or disagree that health professionals have a responsibility to bring the health effects of severe heat waves to the attention of: policy makers?
subconstructs.responseOptions: Strongly disagree, Moderately disagree, Slightly disagree, Neither agree nor disagree, Slightly agree, Moderately agree, Strongly agree

subconstructs.name: Climate Attribution
subconstructs.question: How much do you think climate change is responsible for extreme heat waves in recent years?
subconstructs.responseOptions: Not at all, A little, A moderate amount, A lot, Completely

subconstructs.name: Temporal Proximity of Climate Impact
subconstructs.question: Do you believe climate change will have a significant impact on your daily life? [if 'Yes, I believe it will in the future'] About how many years from now do you expect that impact to begin?
subconstructs.responseOptions: Yes, it already has, Yes, I believe it will in the future, No, it won't impact me + 0 to 50 years

subconstructs.name: Social Norms about Climate Impacts
subconstructs.question: Imagine 10 people like you. If you had to guess, how many of them are currently concerned about the impacts of climate change on their lives?

subconstructs.name: Normative Beliefs on Climate Action
subconstructs.question: Do you think that people should take action to address climate change because it is the right thing to do?
subconstructs.responseOptions: Yes, No

subconstructs.name: Support Government Action
subconstructs.question: Governments must take action immediately to slow climate change in order to prevent extreme weather like heat waves, floods, and other disasters
subconstructs.responseOptions: Strongly disagree, Moderately disagree, Slightly disagree, Neither agree nor disagree, Slightly agree, Moderately agree, Strongly agree

subconstructs.name: Action Intention
subconstructs.question: Please indicate how likely it is that you will take some action to address climate change in the next 12 months? (for example, donate to an environmental organization; speak out about the issue; make a sustainable swap in your daily life; etc.)
subconstructs.responseOptions: Extremely unlikely, Moderately unlikely, Somewhat unlikely, Neither likely nor unlikely, Somewhat likely, Moderately likely, Extremely likely

subconstructs.name: Receive Information
subconstructs.question: Please indicate if you would be willing to receive tailored information via e-mail on how climate change could impact the likelihood of severe heat waves in your area over the next few years?
subconstructs.responseOptions: Yes, No

subconstructs.name: Audience Demand for Climate Content
subconstructs.question: Do you think Hollywood should include more climate-relevant themes and climate-friendly actions on-screen in order to help address climate change?
subconstructs.responseOptions: Yes, No
